website_summaries.verdict: An all-in-one model for the budget-minded consumer.  Though it has a few minor concerns, its multiple features and reasonable price make it worth consideration.
pros: A basic model with a lot of features for a lower-end price – printer, scanner, and copier
Easy to set up and produces crisp copies
cons: Feels less durable than other models, and goes through ink cartridges fairly quickly

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk, was working fine then two months later after moderate use it won't print . It's idle and stuck in "printing... " then at times It'd take a long time to start printing. Save you money and buy something else. Update: 6 months later the printer completely stopped working, and no matter what I did I couldn't make it print. So I ended up throwing it away. Epson you should be ashamed selling this junk to us. That was my first epson purchase and will be my last.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: A Lemon
customer_reviews.text: Would never print without gaps and lines. We did all the head alignment and head cleaning and could never get it to print a single clean page. Very disappointing. We had an Epson printer before for over a decade and it worked, but this one was a dud. Perhaps we just got a lemon, but it couldn't do it's basic, primary job.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Good printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. This is a nice little printer with all the features. I've had several HP Office Jet All-in-one printers in the past that failed due to poor design. I'm done with HP. To me they are no longer the "gold" standard for printers.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Consumer

customer_reviews.title: horrible machine
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this printer. It was terrible. It took a long time to print, it kept going off line and it would only print in orange. I did not receive several faxes that people tried to send to me. I tried everything in the book and after 3 weeks I got fed up and returned it. I need it for business and it was completely unreliable. I then purchased a HP Envy 7645 and it works great. Took a fraction of the time to set up, has worked perfectly since I set it up and was $10 less.
customer_reviews.author: LINDA CLAYTON

customer_reviews.title: Held Hostage by Epson
customer_reviews.text: Largely an ok printer, if a bit noisy and busy. But it is programmed to not allow any printing if one of the ink cartridges needs replacing. It refused to print B&W unless I replaced the magenta and yellow cartridges. I replaced them, but before I could print anything it decided I need to replace the cyan as well. I called tech support and talked to 3 different people: there is not work around. I understand printer manufacturers make their money on ink, but Epson and probably others have decided it is worth forcing you to buy ink you don't need in order to print. I'll do my homework better next time- and not buy Epson.
customer_reviews.author: Colcord

customer_reviews.title: Wireless when it feels like it especially if it needs a firmware update.
customer_reviews.text: We have had our Epson WF-2760 since Sept 2016. It has a mind of its own. It is wireless but 8 times of 10 will send a message “no printer found”. So annoying. Update: I added a star. Go to your printer and write down the IP address and put it in the internet search bar. It will take you to a screen. Follow the screen through. I checked for a firmware update and did need one. The printer should have taken care of that since it is online. It didn't even show an update needed. Anyway, I updated it and went back to the screen from the IP address troubleshooting and finished the process. Everything is working now.
customer_reviews.author: Gunnermccaw

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for a few months, then kicks the bucket
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Spent an hour with Amazon support just to get the device working properly. Now, after a few months, the printing is horrible and the cyan (blue) doesn't print properly. Epson support asks me to do all the steps I have already done, and to "let the printer rest overnight" and try it all again. With brand new ink cartridges, going through the "support steps", now the printer claims I am low in ink. Without having printed a single page that wasn't print head checks. It worked alright for a couple of months (normal personal use), and now it's ready for the curb. Will not be replacing with another Epson.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS THE WORST PRINTER ON THE FACE OF THE EARTH
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS THE WORST PRINTER ON THE FACE OF THE EARTH!!!!! IF YOU DONT MIND DRIVING DOWN THE STREET AND THROWING DOLLAR BILLS OUT THE WINDOW OF YOUR CAR YOU WILL PROBABLY LOVE IT BUT IT GOES THRU SOOOOOOOOOOOOO MUCH INK IT IS INSANE. THIS COMPANY SHOULD BE INVESTIGATED. I WENT THRU OVER $300 IN INK IN ONE YEAR AND BARELY EVER USE A PRINTER. BUY A CANNON OR AN HP OR AN ANYTHING BUT NOT AN EPSON. I HAVE HAD TO REPLACE AN ENTIRE SET OF CARTRIDGES AND LESS THAN 20 PAGES LATER HAD TO DO IT AGAIN. I CALLED TECH SUPPORT AND GOT NO HELP AT ALL!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dixon G.

customer_reviews.title: Ink cartridges need frequent changing
customer_reviews.text: While we like how compact the Epson WF-2760 All-in-One printer is and purchased because the quality seemed high for value, we've found that we have had to replace two of the ink cartridges within two months of purchase and initial use and we are not a family who has a high volume of printing. Having needed to purchase more cartridges so soon decreases the value of this printer. Print details for accompanying image: Magenta ink placed 30 March, 2017; print date 6 May, 2017.
customer_reviews.author: Holly C.

customer_reviews.title: It is a new style and seems better than the last one and it works well
customer_reviews.text: Last year I bought an Epson WF-2650, which was $69. It worked well until last month. When it couldn't print correctly, I connected the service and they told me that it service fee is about $100 per hour plus the costs of the materials of parts, so I had to buy a new one. It is a new style and seems better than the last one and it works well. I copied more than 50 pages color documents last week, it gave me perfect color and quality. I also bought a four-year protection plan with it in case it didn't work again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 4 months of infrequent printing, then ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for 4 months of infrequent printing, then stopped printing entirely. There appears to be a defect with the kind of hardware used in this printer which causes clogs that are difficult to remedy. This is typified by no printing, printing every 2", printing every other line, etc. When using the built in nozzle and head cleaning, I ran through 3 full cartridges trying to get it to print the full page again, and didn't quite get there. Instead of going to the store for more cartridges, I'll just return this and get another brand of printer.
customer_reviews.author: Jared M. Stein

customer_reviews.title: Loud, slow, printing errors.
customer_reviews.text: The printer is compact and a good size. It printed very well for a couple months, but now it consistently has printing errors. I have cleaned the print head multiple times which resolves the issue for the moment, but then it needs cleaning again after printing only a few good pages. It is a loud printer (not so good for a small house) and prints extremely slowly. Overall, I am displeased with the purchase and will return it if possible.
customer_reviews.author: P Grubs

customer_reviews.title: Good printer but you have to change the ink cartridge ...
customer_reviews.text: Good printer but you have to change the ink cartridge way too often ! Even if there is still ink (and a lot of ink !), you've got the message that you have to change the cartridge, and you can't print anymore till you change it. Very frustrating......
customer_reviews.author: clemence douady

customer_reviews.title: Looks better than it performs.
customer_reviews.text: Its cheap, loud and limited. The most annoying thing however, is Epsons Culture of milking customers. So their ink cartridges typically turn out 150-170 sheets, but the same exact size cartridge, in the 220xl version doubles the output. So consider if you want a noisy, 50 sheet holding basic device without a card reader, or if Epson is screwing around. I mean if you went to 7-11, would you fill your big gulp half-way, no, because you paid over a dollar for a soda that costs .12 cents to provide. Epson has not disclosed that your ink cartridge is only half full with the standard cartridge. Food for thought, at least know the game you play with Epson.
customer_reviews.author: OVERWATCH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for my college kid!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my daughter for her dorm and she prints everything! I overrode the warning and use a great aftermarket ink. She loves the way it prints and the features. She can print in class and come back tot the room and the paper is already waiting. Al l te parts are working well and set up was a breeze. She has never set one up before and she didnt need any help at all. Self explanitory. Makes good prints for pics, papers, and her power points. Colors look good and well filled. We do print most things as draft and have some issues with wifi but that has nothing to do witht he printer.
customer_reviews.author: Marinegirl428

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Cheap printer. I ordered it to replace my old college printer which had ink cartridge issues after 2 years. This replacement never worked ever since I bought it. I couldn’t connect it to my laptop and I tried air printing and that always came up with an error code. After many hours on hold with tech support they couldn’t refund my order because the product came already defective. I even bought the square trade warranty but that doesn’t work for my unique situation because the product was still on “manufacturer warranty” for the first year and can’t replace original product defects. At the end of the day I spent $70ish on a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: LoiLoc

customer_reviews.title: This printer is a scam to waste expensive color ink.
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a scam to waste expensive color ink. At some point I was running out of black ink and I got a popup that the printer is switching over to use color ink to create black. Even though I've replaced the black cartridge it never returned to normal mode. It keeps running color cartridges empty to print black. There seems to be no way in the settings to force a change in this behavior. I'm stopping with this review before it turns into a string of expletives...
customer_reviews.author: sleepy in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Worst Printer Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the most frustrating printer I have ever purchased. I have never been able to just print. Every time I need to print I must spend half an hour running thru all the maintainence points trying to get it to work A complete piece of garbage. I should return it but I think instead I will smash it to pieces. Epson, you should be ashamed for putting your name on such a piece of junk. Ink is a total rip off too. Runs out faster than anything I have ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: tbob

customer_reviews.title: Stop the Madness
customer_reviews.text: If you like to change color ink cartridges often this is for you. My error in purchasing and not listening to Amazon customer reviews. Eats Ink like crazy. I have three printers and this one by far uses lots more ink. 95% of my printing on this printer is black only but I am always replacing color cartridges only because it will not allow me to print black until I replace the color cartridges. Giving it away or dumping in garbage. To be fair it does a good job or printing but beware and have lots of back up color cartridges available.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Ciszek

customer_reviews.title: Non functioning product - company living off past accomplishments.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 6th Epson printer and my 3rd in the last 18 months. GARBAGE - keeps claiming paper jams where there are none. GARBAGE - won't print #10 envelopes (yes setting have been changed) GARBAGE - won't print labels with out 2 claims of paper jamming - no paper except laying correctly in tray. GARBAGE - touch screen - bottom third of the touch screen dosen't recognize touches. THIS COMPANY IS LIVING OFF AN EARLIER REPUTATION - current product not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Private Name

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: This printer totally rocks. Print quality is good, output is fast, and the price is right. The ink comes in tanks that hold more ink than conventional cartridges. I took a chance and ordered the knock off ink cartridges, and they work. Another thing is that the printer always (yes I said always) wakes up and prints. My old printer drove us crazy and never woke up when we wanted it to. Don't listen to the people that say it's hard to set up. If you can hit next, next, finish, you can install this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R.

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer I’ve Ever Owned!
customer_reviews.text: Ahhhh, I love my printer!!!! I got such a good deal on this!! I’m so glad I made the decision to buy it. This has been the best printer I’ve ever owned. Easy to use. Print quality is great! It scans, copies & faxes! All features are so easy to use. I like that I can scan stuff directly to cloud or email. Ink is easy to change. Also good deals on ink is available on Amazon. I would most definitely buy this printer again! Yesssss!! I want to get my sister one too!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda McCarrell

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Owned this for a year, so just passed the warranty. Suddenly black ink just stops printing. Went through 2 more cartridges testing it before it was clear the head was irreparably clogged. "Sorry, nothing we can do." Goes in the trash. Don't waste your money. The volume per cartridge is abysmally low. Lucky to get 400 sheets out of a $25 black cartridge. Going laser, never going back to this garbage. Would rather pay $65 for toner and get over 2000 pages. The material is incredibly flimsy too. Not a sturdy work-force printer.
customer_reviews.author: Alex T

customer_reviews.title: This was a great purchase decision
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase decision. I have not had any issues with the printer and it functions and operates exactly as the product listing describes. I especially love this printer because of its wireless capabilities and the ease of setting it up. It was not difficult to set up at all. Also an added benefit is the individual color ink cartridges which means you spend less money on ink cartridges because you only replace the specific color cartridge that is empty as opposed to cartridges that have multiple colors contained within.
customer_reviews.author: AP3 Maximilian

customer_reviews.title: It's either a lemon or not a good product -- sorry Epson, but you can do better.
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing this printer, I waited too long to ship it back so I'm stuck with it. I'm very disappointed in the quality of the printer. It is loud, eats up a lot of ink, doesn't print envelopes and doesn't scan well. If it is made like this on purpose, then it's a lousy product. If it isn't made like this, then it's a lemon. I tried to send it back, printed out the label and boxed it up and everything then didn't get it mailed back in time. So, I just stare at it and will it to work and hope that it does. Sometimes it does, sometimes it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Darla Z

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst printer I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst printer I have ever owned! The positive reviews have to be false. As soon as I changed the first ink cartridge the printer would no longer print. I wasted a whole day trying to figure out the issue. Epson support blamed Apple for being incompatible but the problem is a clogged print head. I am not taking apart the whole printer to try and dissolve a clogged print head every time I change an ink cartridge, which by the way holds very little ink. This is a piece of garbage!
customer_reviews.author: VMac

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this printer
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this printer. The quality of documents it prints are simply 'okay' and nothing more. Goes through ink quickly. Scanning tray can handle maybe 5-6 papers before it jams itself. I've been told by vendors and customers who receive our FAX transmissions that the quality is poor. Printer stops functioning if ink is low (yes, many people like to print in black ink only, but you'll need to keep your color ink in stock or else it won't work). On the plus side the ink isn't overly expensive?
customer_reviews.author: Chels

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy
customer_reviews.text: This printer is very difficult to work with. I bought it for my husband as a backup to our cannon printer which he doesn't like. This one is a nightmare. You basically have to babysit it as it is printing as it continually jams or states it has jammed paper which is not there. The color I found to be less than favorable. I had to reprint all with my cannon printer. In addition to these problems, there was no paper work was included. With some equipment there is at least a paper that will direct you to their web site but this had nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't scan when out of ink
customer_reviews.text: The ink is ridiculously expensive and I use my housemates. He doesn't have a scanner and I need one a few times a month. Low and behold it won't scan without ink. A couple times I sort of fooled it and it did, but it must have learned so it could trick me some more. I'm going to give away free to whoever wants it on some site or other and search for a decent printer, even if I have to pay more. I'll admit it DOES jam less than my 3 former HPs did, which is I why I finally dumped HP. But at least I could use the scanner on it when out of ink.
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Lee

customer_reviews.title: A full-featured printer at a bargain price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom after her ancient printer (also an Epson) died. For myself I have an XP-820 which I love, and the WF-2760 had all the features my mom wanted (and more!) at a very reasonable price. I do note that Consumer Reports had this model at the bottom of their charts, partly due to it using more ink for "maintenance" than other models. But as a printer and scanner, it works well - clear prints (it isn't a photo printer) and my mom loves the auto-feed scanner that can do 2-sided scanning (and printing).
customer_reviews.author: S. Lionel

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned a printer that decides you cannot print when it wants. I have a full black XL cartridge but I need the color cartridges. I am not allowed to print in black and white only. So, I am forced to buy color in order to print in black and white. It also says you need to replace the ink well before you need to and you cannot override the the printer's decision. This printer is a money pit and the frustration of it is NOT worth it!! I'm going back to HP. I will never buy Epson again.
customer_reviews.author: E. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Had Trouble Since Day 1
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this copier again. Small footprint is good. Okay when it actually prints. Many times, we have to unplug the machine, and then reconnect electricity in order to get it to print what is in queue. Purchased in November and now it is printing so light that the pages are not legible. I have performed maintenance on the machine, cleaned the heads, aligned the print head, etc. and nothing is working.
customer_reviews.author: mmarciante

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup/use but eats ink rapidly
customer_reviews.text: I am really disappointed on how much color ink this multi function unit uses. I mostly use it to scan or make black and white copies and the occasional fax. I have a high speed laserjet printer so I only print occasionally but rarely in color yet I have had to change color cartridges on multiple occasions. I finally opted to buy re-manufactured cartridges to save some money. Overall this Epson all-in-one unit has worked well and met my needs.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainPico

customer_reviews.title: Good quality prints and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Really nice printer. Can scan, fax, and print. Apps also allow to print from an Android phone (I don't have an iPhone so don't know for sure). Ink seems to hold up well so far. Small footprint helps keep it out of the way. Auto duplex (print on both sides) is great. I would never buy a printer I had to flip the pages to print on both sides. Setup was easy and I have a few devices connected to it.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Matthew

customer_reviews.title: This is the most difficult to use printer I have ever owned!!
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely ready to pitch this printer out the door!. It won't connect wirelessly to my iMac (for some obscure reason), it repeatedly states that it's not connected to the computer when it IS connected by a cable. It won't scan a smaller object (a 3X5 card even when it's set to that size. ) I don't have the time and patience to try to make this work. I've tried to call customer support, but the telephone never rings, So obviously they are of no help! Anyone want this thing? Good price for a new, slightly used printer!
customer_reviews.author: bibbugs

customer_reviews.title: Wow, Really....
customer_reviews.text: OK, I like cheap printers. Had brother for years. thought I would change, tried this Epson, I really regret it. LOUD!!!. Wow the things and sounds that go on to print just one page, amazing. My wife always comments, that printed the s__t out of that page. Now I replace the black ink and get nothing. Search internet no luck, call Epson, they only staff work hours not evenings. I need to print, I work all day and all evening. I may have to go to Staples and buy another BROTHER!!!! DO NOT buy this. Buy a brother, just as cheap ink is expensive, but at least it works..................
customer_reviews.author: R. Lindell

customer_reviews.title: Epson outsources their tech support like most tech companies these days who just run through ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked for *almost* a year then black ink just stopped coming out. Epson outsources their tech support like most tech companies these days who just run through a checklist. They did offer to replace the printer eventually but only because I was lucky enough to have it break before the one year warranty expired. Hope you're not one of the unlucky ones who gets to day 366 before it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Terrific printer!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for several weeks now and am very pleased with it. Decided to purchase a new one since my old was getting obsolete and the replacement cartridges were almost the same price as this one! Don't care about faxing, but the copy, scan and print features are all working well from both a Mac platform and a Windows 10 platform, wirelessly. The scanning to the Windows machine does need the USB connection, apparently, but that isn't a problem. Have also printed from my iPad! All in all, a great printer! Yes, I have had to already replace the cartridges because they only send sample cartridges with the printer, but that is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Headache.  Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been trouble from day one. Now it just no longer prints. Nada. Zilch. Zip. Zero. Very unhappy given that we JUST purchased new ink. There is only so much troubleshooting one can do with a not so great piece of equipment. Both my husband and I are techno savvy but we've given up on troubleshooting this printer. It is just not a superior product. The end.
customer_reviews.author: Recovering Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: print quality is not good for me- sucks ink fast
customer_reviews.text: scans ok/ gui is old like the one I have from years ago but works ok. printing is terrible. unacceptable really. a standard 12pt font word doc prints sketchy. two black cartridges and on second set of color. btw it wont print in just black if the color inks are low?? whatt?? not happy at all with the printing. it will print sharp if I bump up the font and density, like in bold.. yes ive realigned and cleaned and done all the maintenance to the extent of exhausting the ink. what happened Epson? used to rock the print.....
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Working fine and the price was right after shopping Office Depot ...
customer_reviews.text: Working fine and the price was right after shopping Office Depot and online. Lots of good reviews(except, as usual the cost of new ink cartridges!) and for a guy who uses it for simple copying it's just right so far. It is noisier than the 8 year old HP I used when I had Windows 7. But it's just when you print and turn it on and off. There's a Bing and sound of machinery. No big deal. Not nearly as loud as my GE washer. So, happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: al

customer_reviews.title: Worthless piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a piece of junk. It clanks, bangs, vibrates and shakes the stand I have it on. It is also complicated to use, is NOT user friendly and product support is based on the owner doing all diagnostics himself via its program or the "net". If you are able to get through to customer support, the first level of helpers are worthless. You must go up 2 or 3 levels of supervisors to get someone that knows what they are doing. I got so ticked-off at spending HOURS on the phone dealing with them, first in Guatemala then the Philippines, that I returned the product and ordered a Canon. G.V. from California
customer_reviews.author: george vanek

customer_reviews.title: It worked fine until it died
customer_reviews.text: I had an Epson wifi printer before this one. It worked fine until it died. This printer did not reliably work with my wifi. The printer would not remember the wifi network. I tried everything and reset my router and moved the printer closer to the router. I returned one and ordered another. Neither worked. Bought an HP.
customer_reviews.author: Silicon Valley VP

customer_reviews.title: This printer was quick and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This printer was quick and easy to install. In less than 45 minutes, I had it unpacked, set up, and installed on a PC, a Mac, and could print from 2 iPhones and an iPad. It found my wifi and set up was a breeze - even on the Mac. It IS very loud - crazy loud, actually - like another customer mentioned. But it's not a problem for me since it's back in the office. It works very fast and prints even faster. Catridges are easy to install and I went ahead and bought another pack of color and black just to have. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: I tried all the trouble-shooting options I could find online and some made the issue worse. Don't waste your money on this one
customer_reviews.text: Feels cheap. LOUD operation. Goes through cartridges about 5x faster than my last Epson all-in-one. Black stopped printing properly after about 6 weeks. After buying 2 new black cartridges, determined the problem is the printer. I tried all the trouble-shooting options I could find online and some made the issue worse. Don't waste your money on this one. I'm trying to warranty it with Amazon, otherwise I'm just throwing it away. Very disappointing performance. I gave it 2 stars because when it worked for 6 weeks, the prints looked good.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Disgusted!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible printer, it does not work, it constantly prints either half a page or it is totally smudged and I cannot make out what the print says. I have tried everything the customer service representatives have recommended. I have found countless complaints about this printer and the way it prints. I replaced the ink twice, called customer service to find out why it would not print properly, blank pages or smudged pages kept coming out I was on the phone with them for over 45 minutes and it still did not work. I would like to return this printer at Amazons cost and replace it with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, fast printer that is an ink killing machine!
customer_reviews.text: Fast printing printer that produces great quality images, however if you're looking for a printer who's ink last a long time-this isn't the printer for you! It is an ink killing machine. Next purchase will be for a laser jet printer where the ink does really last for a while. It seems every month I have to order a new set of ink cartridges. And as you can see they're not exactly cheap! Hopefully Epson will come up with a better solution on this.
customer_reviews.author: B. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: I really liked this printer because it has so many nice features
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this printer because it has so many nice features: Auto Document Feeder, Scanner, Fax, and the wifi connection, direct connect printing were all convenient to use. Sadly though, after less than a year of using it, it is refusing to print properly. Not really sure why, I changed the black ink cartridge and now it is refusing to print properly...I tried running the "nozzle head alignment" and the "clean print head" operations both but still no change...
customer_reviews.author: pearlpen

customer_reviews.title: Two years of a bad relationship
customer_reviews.text: This printer sucks. While my husband can never seem to make it work, I would always put into the TLC of trying to get it to stay working. It was two years of about 4 days total of wasted time here and there trying to keep the printer happy and working. It was super temperamental. Sometimes it would work and sometimes it wouldn't. More often then not it wouldn't work. Save yourself the frustration and just get another printer that doesn't suck.
customer_reviews.author: HannahP

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this printer or any other EPSON printer or product
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the worst printer I have ever owned in my life. EPSON has no interest in providing an even semi-usable piece of equipment. The ink runs out so fast and is so expensive that you'll either be forced to pay for the ink or buy another printer. This is a pathetic excuse for a printer and EPSON is pure garbage. Don't buy this or any other EPSON product. It's not worth it and won't be usable when you actually need it.
customer_reviews.author: Sagar Mamania

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Florida
customer_reviews.text: We have had this printer only 6 months and it copies information that we send to it from our phones or computer, but it will not copy things that we put on the print screen. This has been a huge frustration for us. When we call Epson, we get someone in India who wants to sell us a service contract for over a $100+. A salesperson in Staples said that the motor for printing is probably not working. Very poor scenario for a printer!
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about a year and then it was done - just quit printing despite cleaning the cartridge and replacing ink multiple times. Very noisy when it did work and always dumped paper on the ground. The plastic latch that was supposed to hold the paper tray in place never completely grabbed so I was frequently tipping the printer upside down to manually click the locking mechanism in place. I will not be buying Epson products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Fisher

customer_reviews.title: recommended.. good quality.. remember it's always the ink that costs a lot..
customer_reviews.text: it's always the ink that matters since most of these printers cost is reasonable.. buy the larger ink cartridges which do cost a bit more.. about 55 dollars for the 3 colors and the black ink.. the printer itself does work well and even does double sided by refeeding itself so you don't have to do anything.. the printing is sharp and it does envelopes also.. all in all I recommend it..
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRINTER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is not worth 2 cents. When you change the cartridge you need to make sure you are qualified because the pins on the printer will break off if you are not professional trained to remove them. At first I thought it was my fault so I purchased another one, and this time was super careful not to bend or break the contact pins go to change the black ink and ping, the pin breaks off. I can not use the printer at all I can't even use the scan function or copy. ITS a big POS and going in the trash buy a different printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Great printer, easy setup. I think their install puts some useless software on your computer but all in all this thing works great and their online services are pretty good too. My kids can email photos to my printer. It is nice to wake up to a smiling grandchild sitting on the printer.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Sklar

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and value, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a family member about a month and so far so good. Easily connected to the wireless network with the WPS connection (literally just a couple button presses). Printing & scanning with Windows with installed software. iPhone/ iOS connects on its own. All have worked well so far, print is fast, quality is crisp. Very happy with this printer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Ok quality but terribly noisy and eats up ink
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer based on reviews and the size. I have to say that for those reasons it won. However, be forewarned that this printer is (a) noisy and (b) sucks up ink like no tomorrow. This feels very razor and blade business model like where the printer was affordable and meets some minimum requirements but Epson is going to rake the money in from buyers suckered into the device by paying for ink. I would suggest looking at another brand all together if you're considering this device.
customer_reviews.author: GreenOooLaLa

customer_reviews.title: Workforce all-in-one printers are time-proven
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this Epson WF-2760 long, but it replaced an aging Epson Workforce all-in-one printer that performed well for many years. Using an wired networking connection, setup was quick and easy. Print quality is top shelf and the colors are vivid. The 2-sided printing works seamlessly, and it makes great copies. Do not intend to use it for faxing, but like that it can if needed. I also purchased the 4-year Asurion protection plan from Amazon for an extremely low price.
customer_reviews.author: kix66

customer_reviews.title: Feels like I bought this off a truck from scam artists; box claims state-of-the-art, looks pretty: but inside, it's GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Printer is aesthetically pleasing, with sleek, black finish and smooth curves. Printer is heavy, and could possibly be used for self defense. Cons: Everything else. This printer is garbage. Guzzles ink cartridges that can be more expensive as a set than the printer itself, yet won't let you finish all (or even what feels like most) of the ink. Has the least intuitive menu system I've ever run across, and an absolutely useless user manual. I work IT on a regular basis and it took me AN HOUR to figure out how to get it TO MAKE COPIES for my folks, who unfortunately, I bought this hunk of junk for.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kinsey

customer_reviews.title: Waste of my hard earned money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I let too much time lapse before having this printer hooked up so I cannot return it. This printer was recommended to me buy a local store which did not have it in stock at the time. I had a technician hook up the printer in April 2017 because I could not get it to work properly and I have yet to print out anything from my computer nor can I even make a legible copy of any document. This is the worst printer I have ever wasted my money on and I would not recommend this particular printer to anyone and at this point I would never even recommend any Epson brand printer!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Amazon, do your customers a favor by discontinuing this item.
customer_reviews.text: Spend your money on something that will last for more than a few months!!! Two reasons this is a piece of junk: 1) I have, being generous, printed about 50 pages, which has used up 2 black cartridges. 2) The reason I can't print more is because it no longer works. It just makes a whirling noise and some other awful sounds until I power it off. Amazon, do your customers a favor by discontinuing this item.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Z

customer_reviews.title: I use a common brand RoyalBrites Premium Photo paper that always work fine on my HP printers
customer_reviews.text: The Epson WF-2760 is louder then my garden tracker. When trying to copy photos to glossy photo paper it jams. after several hours with Epson's tech support, their solution was for me to go and buy Epson's Glossy Photo Paper. From where I live the nearest dealer that carries Epson's glossy photo paper is a thirty minute drive. I use a common brand RoyalBrites Premium Photo paper that always work fine on my HP printers. Would I recommend Epson printers; absolutely not. And as a Premium AMAZON customer I would have hoped to return this defective printer in exchange for a HP printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer on the market
customer_reviews.text: When I first purchased this printer it seemed to work great, but before too long I was buying ink... then more and more ink. Even if you do not use it after installing a new ink cartridge it will tell you the ink is low after a few months and will not even try to print until the cartridge is replaced. It constantly reads that the ink is clogged and is about the biggest pain of a printer I have ever used. Have never even been through 1/4 a package of paper and this printer is in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor print quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of these printers I've tried - after returning the first one. Both have developed problems within a few months with lighter quality print lines probably due to print head issues. Nothing I've done has been able to clear up the problem. Multiple head cleaning, replacing the cartridges, making sure software and firmware are current, etc. Going to try and return this and maybe get something that works for a reasonable period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Ed

customer_reviews.title: Just Awful
customer_reviews.text: Owned for less than a year and replacing. 1) Slow. This thing takes longer to warm up than any other device I have ever seen. Especially when replacing ink cartridges. I don't know what exactly it is going through, but ridiculous. 2) Will NOT print if out of any color. If you are out of yellow, it will not let you continue to print and go to black.
customer_reviews.author: S Vegors

customer_reviews.title: This is a great printer. It prints very nice in both color ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer. It prints very nice in both color and black and white. It prints very thin detailed lines. It uses a small to moderate amount of ink. I have had mine for about 3 months and the black ink is still over 3/4 full. There is only one negative thing I can say about this printer. It is loud. Doesn't matter to me since it does such a great job!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had listened to the negative reviews....
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Workforce 545 printer that got heavy use over the years and was a fabulous printer. This 2760 however is the biggest piece of electronic junk I have ever owned. I mean seriously - the WORST. I read the reviews and wish I had listened. It fails to recognize Epson ink cartridges that I bought on Epson.com! It randomly stops working. The print quality when it does work, sucks. I'd spend an hour listing all the problems, but it's just not worth the effort. Do yourself a favor and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: brother maynard

customer_reviews.title: bought 2 and both are crap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer and then it stopped printing properly and since i had a ton of ink already i bought the same one again. Same problem. It started printing streaky and non legible after a few months. I want to return it but they don't give me that option. This printer is crap and i am highly dissapponted that i do not have the option to return ONE of the 2 that have failed me shortly after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Heredia

customer_reviews.title: another piece of junk with clogged printhead
customer_reviews.text: Lifespan of Epson printers in my household is about 6-9 months before it decides it no longer wants to print. I am done buying Epson. I have three junk printers all with clogged printheads, even after using only Epson ink and the printhead cleaning kit. I use the printer at least weekly to make sure the ink pigments do not settle, so...thanks Epson for the poor quality of printers you are putting out there nowadays. Anyone looking to Frankenstein a printer together with these spare parts?
customer_reviews.author: azumaya

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this printer based on various reviews indicating it is a great value for the money and easy to use. I've had it for a few weeks and have used all of the features. It has lived up to the reviews and recommendations. I think it is a great buy and recommend it. It was super easy to set up and even easier to use. It is also a nice compact size and fits on top of a standard bookcase sized shelf.
customer_reviews.author: RGomez1120

customer_reviews.title: Not a great printer
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this printer which worked immediately on set up with both my macbook and ipad. Nice quality printouts and wireless printing and scanning. I'm really happy I bought it. Updating my previous review. Deeply disappointed in this machine - It started spitting out blank pages after about 6 months so I replaced the ink cartridges. No go. Spent all afternoon cleaning the print heads, etc, and no go. I'm really reluctant to waste more money on cartridges so it's off to the recycling center.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J. Mumford

customer_reviews.title: Epson printers rock!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why this printer is getting so many bad reviews. Epson printers, in general, have performed flawlessly for me and this model is no exception. I've been using it now for over a year and I love it. I do order the cheap generic ink and I've never had an issue. I purchased a Canon before this one and returned it. Happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Casey H.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Color, Fast Printing!
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box this printer looked sharp, had easy instructions, and prints like a champion! I got the newer version (2760) and it was cheaper than the older one! Great price, fast shipping (I don't know how you do it Amazon but keep it up). The printing this Epson does is brilliant; bright colors, fast full page printing, and it works with wifi. I didn't want a bunch of more cables going into my computer so this is perfect. Overall 10/10, get this printer.
customer_reviews.author: MrGreeneInTheKitchenWithLeadPipe

customer_reviews.title: Switching to a laser printer and going for good luck.
customer_reviews.text: After trying yet AGAIN, this printer gives up the ghost after less than six months. New, Epson ink, printer head cleaning, nossle check. .. all the options, still too streaky to read. This was a third try. Don't buy this. Switching to a laser printer and going for good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Jean S

customer_reviews.title: but this budget printer is amazing! I replaced an HP all in one printer ...
customer_reviews.text: Granted, I am writing my review before I even have to purchase ink refills, but this budget printer is amazing! I replaced an HP all in one printer that I hated and that never worked properly with this Epson all in one, and the Epson brand had knocked it out of the park! It sets up easily, online, it scans well, and I love that it prints two sided without my having to even turn the pages over! Maybe I was just in the dark ages too long with the HP? Ya think?
customer_reviews.author: Fishergirl

customer_reviews.title: Reliability problems with Epson printers
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Epson printer I purchased through amazon. The first one failed in less than a year. This one purchased on April 18, 2017 will not print black ink. We have only used one black cartridge. Dealing with the Square Trade warranty is very cumbersome and time consuming.
customer_reviews.author: Pleased customer

customer_reviews.title: not a good deal!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer middle of Nov. 2016. It has quit. I've tried everything I know how. I also purchased the extended warranty contract for 3 years. Found that and filled out the necessary information online for this. Their response was contact the manufacturer! Claim closed!!!
customer_reviews.author: psoup

customer_reviews.title: Printer is a ink drainer. Not to be used for business.
customer_reviews.text: This items print is okay. The problem is the ink. If using for business this is not the printer for you. Everyday I have to change all the ink cartridges. I only print 28 color copies, and I have to put in 4 ink cartridges. I had to buy another printer. This one will only be used in emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: BALINDA M.

customer_reviews.title: A great value from Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent all in one printer, and I love the features!! Read all the literature included in the shipment and then go online for more tips. It will make your life more stress free as you set it up. Ink consumption seems much less than others when printing black and white. That alone amazed me. Ships with larger ink supply than I was expecting. As I always recommend......set it up when you have nothing else in the works. Took me seventy years to figure that one out!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Swinford

customer_reviews.title: I bought 3 of these, only 1 still works
customer_reviews.text: The mechanism to advance the print head must be fragile. 2 of these machines are not useable because I can't align the print head. One machine will not print in black, although it will print in blue. I put in new black ink cartridges and did the nozzle cleaning a dozen times before I bought a Brother multi function machine, (I have one of these that has been working well for a few years.)
customer_reviews.author: AlanF

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL
customer_reviews.text: I owned the WF4520 and loved it so when it was time to replace it I purchased the WF2760. What a mistake!! It is awful. It will not stay hooked up to the WIFI. It tells me constantly it is "off-line". It will not print photos on standard 8x11 paper without you having to manually get up and tell it to do it. It was a total waste of my money and not worth the headaches and aggravation it has caused so I will be replacing it ASAP
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully I can get a response from a canon representative ...
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully I can get a response from a canon representative. I have contacted their customer service center for assistance numerous times and have been assured of a call back. NOT YET. I have had canon printers before and with little mishaps but this seems to have trouble. I have lines that are not printing. I have done all the trouble shoot and really this review is to hopefully get some help.
customer_reviews.author: AMc

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, slow on scaning
customer_reviews.text: Has worked well over WiFi since purchasing about 3 months ago. However scanning is slow, especially when using the document feeder. I tried using it on lower resolution and in black and white, but it doesn't seem to help much. If you're buying in order to do a lot of scanning, this may not be the one. I replaced my Epson WF-633 with this WF-2760 because the WF-633 did not work well once I went to Windows 10 OS. The WF-2760 works well with Windows 10, but scanning speed remains a problems.
customer_reviews.author: Extraginger

customer_reviews.title: If you love to replace ink, this is the printer for you
customer_reviews.text: This printer eats ink cartridges. We print less than 100 pages a month, and it seems we are replacing one or more cartridges every month. Also, will not print in B&W if one of the color cartridges is empty, forcing a fast replacement. I would not recommend this item
customer_reviews.author: michelle hecht

customer_reviews.title: love the printer functions so far
customer_reviews.text: just getting at setting up wireless mode. not sure how far away I can put the printer from my laptop and still get service! will add more when finalize the setup. love the printer functions so far,
customer_reviews.author: fl hull

customer_reviews.title: Tech Support was not helpful.
customer_reviews.text: The Installation CD did not work properly. Only the fax printer was installed during the installation process. The first call to TS lasted 37 minutes and was of no help. On the second call to TS, it took an hour and 14 minutes to finally get to Tier 2 support, and while waiting for Tier 2, I solved the problem myself. It has been working perfectly and the ink is much cheaper than the ink from HP.
customer_reviews.author: William H.

customer_reviews.title: Has not proven to be User friendly for this home!
customer_reviews.text: While it does work, it doesn't allow the option of saving your scans/copies/faxes to a specific location on your computer. The fax function works sporatically & Epson states it is because we have a VOIP landline! We're very dissatisfied with this model & while customer service is always available, they aren't able to resolve the issues.
customer_reviews.author: Margo

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive "All in One"
customer_reviews.text: For the price.. a great 'all-in-one'. The first one I received had an issue with scanning, but as usual, Amazon customer service is fantastic. The replacement they sent works flawlessly. The Wi-Fi feature is great, I keep this printer in my bedroom, my laptop is in the living room.. no problems connecting. I've long been a fan of Epson printers, I also have a large format 6 color, Artisan1430 that I use for special printing.. But for general purposes this WF-2760 is great.. even for photo printing 4 color in smaller formats.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Hale

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer at a Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best printers I have owned thus far. Very easy to connect to all my devices, iPhones, iPads, MacBooks, Windows computers, etc. The 2760 prints quickly and fairly quietly, efficiently uses ink, and the pages printed are all high quality. The document feeder makes scanning documents very easy, and the software it comes with is easy to use. I haven't tried photos (easier and cheaper to order from walmart, shutter fly, etc). If you can get your hands on one of these, do it! You can't beat the price of this printer, especially one that works as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher N. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Was nice.  Now garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this printer 6 months ago. Was a nice printer/scanner for occasional home use, and it worked just fine. Note my use of past tense. The printer has now developed a problem with horizontal banding (blank lines through the print rendering it unreadable). After running countless print head cleanings and nozzle alignments the problem remains. After days trying to deal with this, It is not worth spending any more time on trying to get it to work, or dealing with Epson's tedious warranty procedures. It is now ready for the trash. To bad. It WAS a nice little printer/scanner.
customer_reviews.author: LILARRY

customer_reviews.title: Gulps Ink, Poor connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Terrible printer. Goes through ink cartridges like they were water. And after a year starts losing its wireless connectivity. Most print jobs now take two attempts. And if it does work, will take literally one to two minutes to start. AVOID
customer_reviews.author: Old Goat

customer_reviews.title: I had to get my little Epson back out and it so much better than this one
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother. It's hard to believe it is an Epson. It's so loud you can hear it from the front of the house with the tv going. Not to mention the paper tray is now not working. It's very cheaply made. I had to get my little Epson back out and it is so much better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Missy B.

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer purchased
customer_reviews.text: Have problems with the printer 3 months from purchasing. I got a Refurbished one as a replacement which I was not pleased about. The replacement one ended up doing the same problem. The ink tends to clog up beyond repair.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Had an Epson printer before that was solid for about ...
customer_reviews.text: Had an Epson printer before that was solid for about 2 years. Bought this printer in August 2016, and it has been a consistent problem since I bought it. Unbelievably unreliable, always have to worry that I can print something for whatever reason. I bought new ink cartridges for it, and the blue won't print out, no matter what maintenance I do. And the magenta and yellow cartridges cannot be "recognized". It's ridiculous. I don't think I've ever been so angry at a single piece of equipment. I will be trying to get my money back in some way.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Good little printer.
customer_reviews.text: Good little printer. I bought it because the ink was cheaper on average but the ink doesn't seem to last very long, especially with non-use. Every now and then it loses connection and you have to do a printer dance to get it to work again (or just unplug and turn back on) but that could be caused by a number of things and not necessarily the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Whitty

customer_reviews.title: Dry Ink, unpredictable wireless connection.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t read the rest of the reviews but I’m so very disappointed in this printer. It doesn’t do well with wireless connection and the ink would consistently dry out. I had purchased two of these because they’re so cheap but it’s not worth the headache. I switch brands and went to Brother.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Ok for price
customer_reviews.text: The printer is fine but the paper feeder on top is a problem. It constantly jams and does not feed the paper properly. I also don't like that you have to remove the letter size paper to print an envelope; my old printer would allow you to insert the envelope without removing the paper and adjusting the guides. It was easy to install, but I had to download the installer instead of using the cd that was provided; not sure why.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: Good printer, horrible scanner
customer_reviews.text: Worked great right out of the box, easy to set up. The printer function worked well, but I bought it for the scanning function. Lasted about 6 months before the scanner auto feeder stopped working. They sent a replacement right away (a refurbished model-not too happy about that) which lasted about 3 months before the whole thing seized up. I had bought the extended warranty and they just recommended to reimburse me instead of replace it again.
customer_reviews.author: bug nurse

customer_reviews.title: POOR PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A PIECE OF JUNK.. I HAVE HAD THIS PRINTER FOR LESS THAN 2 MONTHS AND IT WILL NO LONGER PRINT IN BLACK. I WON'T BUY ANOTHER EPSON PRINTER. WHEN I CALLED EPSON THEY TRIED TO SELL ME SOFTWARE TO CORRECT THE ERRORS IN MY SYSTEM. THAT ISN'T HAPPENING. I WILL CORRECT THIS PROBLEM AND BE DONE WITH EPSON PRODUCTS
customer_reviews.author: bILL

customer_reviews.title: Great. Spend a little more money and get something ...
customer_reviews.text: No. The wireless/bluetooth on this is very shotty. As soon as I had to replace the black ink cartridge it stopped printing correctly. I called the company and their advice was to run the "head cleaner" 3x and then do a test print. I've done this 3 times and it's still not working. And now it's saying I need to replace the colored ink which I haven't even been using. All of those test prints used all the color ink. Great. Spend a little more money and get something better quality. This all-in-one is not it. Has barely worked properly since I got it last year.
customer_reviews.author: Emily B.

product_meta.title: Epson WF-2760 All-in-One Wireless Color Printer with Scanner, Copier, Fax, Ethernet, Wi-Fi Direct & NFC, Amazon Dash Replenishment Ready
product_meta.description: Style:WF-2760 - NewVersatile, fast and reliable, The workforce WF-2760 all-in-one printer features the ultimate in wireless connectivity plus Ethernet for your home office. Powered by revolutionary Precision Core technology, the WF-2760 delivers laser-quality performance. Print sharp, professional-quality documents - even from your iPad, iPhone, Android tablet or smartphone. It also includes NFC T capability. A 2. 7" Color touchscreen makes setup and navigation easy. Other features include auto 2-sided printing and a 30-page auto document feeder, Plus a 150-sheet capacity, so you'll reload less often. Also, affordable individual ink cartridges mean you replace only the color you need. It's the smart choice for fast, easy printing. this Epson printer is designed for use with only genuine Epson-brand cartridges. Other brands of ink cartridges and ink supplies are not compatible and, even if described as Compatible, may not function properly or at all. Epson provides information about the design of the printer on the box and in many other locations and materials Included with the printer and on the website. Epson periodically provides firmware updates to address issues of security, performance, minor bug fixes and ensure the printer functions as designed. This printer was designed to work only with genuine Epson ink cartridges and some updates may affect the functionality of third party ink. Non-Epson branded or Altered Epson cartridges that functioned prior to a firmware update may not continue to function. Operating Temperature : 50 Degree Fahrenheit ; to 95 Degree Fahrenheit (10° to 35° Celsius). Storage Temperature : -4 Degree Fahrenheit to 104 Degree Fahrenheit (-20° to 40° Celsius).
feature_bullets: This printer is designed for use with Epson cartridges only, not third party cartridges or ink. Cartridges described as Compatible, Remanufactured, refilled or refillable may not work properly or at all. See product description for more details
Get laser-quality performance - The workforce WF-2760, powered by Precision Core.
Ultimate wireless solution Plus Ethernet - easy iPad, iPhone, Android tablet and smartphone printing; Includes Wi-Fi Direct for network-free printing and NFC touch-to-print capability.
Easy setup and navigation - 2. 7" Color touchscreen to easily print, copy, scan and fax
Reload paper less often - 150-sheet paper capacity

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.2 out of 5 stars1,530 ratings3.2 out of 5 stars
